characters: I HATE TO GO AND LEAVE THIS PRETTY SIGHT
I'D LIKE TO STAY AND TASTE MY FIRST
SO LONG, FAREWELL, AUF WIEDERSEHEN, ADIEU
THERE'S A SAD SORT OF CLANGING FROM THE CLOCK
TO SAY GOODBYE . . .TO YOU. SO LONG, FAREWELL,
REGRETFULLY THEY TELL US CUCKOO, CUCKOO
AND UP IN THE NURSERY AN ABSURD LITTLE BIRD
BUT FIRMLY THEY COMPEL US CUCKOO, CUCKOO
THE SUN HAS GONE TO BED AND SO MUST I
IN THE HALL AND THE BELLS IN THE STEEPLE TOO
I FLIT, I FLOAT, I FLEETLY FLEE, I FLY
SO LONG, FAREWELL, AUF WIEDERSEHEN, GOODBYE
ADIEU, ADIEU, TO YIEU AND YIEU AND YIEU
I'M GLAD TO GO, I CANNOT TELL A LIE
SO LONG, FAREWELL, AU REVOIR, AUF WIEDERSEHEN

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 7 EXT. THE CAPTAINS MANSION
dialogues.text: The children are on the veranda outside of the party. Frau Smmidt & Frau Franz enter. Gretle bows to them

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN SCHMITT
dialogues.text: No, a lady curtsies. (Gretel curtsies) ThatвЂ™s right. You must do that to all of the guests.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: All of them. WonвЂ™t my knees get tired?

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN HELGA
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s the price of being a lady.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISA
dialogues.text: Everyone looks so beautiful. I guess we look beautiful too!  "The Sound of Musc" 34.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I think they look ugly.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISA
dialogues.text: You just say that because youвЂ™re scared.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Silly, only grown-up men are scared of women.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: We've never had a party in the house before, this is so exciting.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN SCHMITT
dialogues.text: Oh yes, there used to be lots of parties here.

dialogues.speaker: LIESL
dialogues.text: Freidrick & I used to sneak out and watch everyone from the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEDRICK
dialogues.text: I remember the music. Once father brought a Gypsy orchestra all the way from Budapest!

dialogues.speaker: FREISEL
dialogues.text: Yes, they wore red coats! Lesil & Freisel begin to dance with a pretend partner

dialogues.speaker: BRIGITTA
dialogues.text: Who are you dancing with?

dialogues.speaker: FRIEDRICK
dialogues.text: Me. Freidrick taps Liesl on the shoulder & they begin to dance.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Yuck. Maria enters.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well, why didnвЂ™t you children tell me you could dance?

dialogues.speaker: BRIGITTA
dialogues.text: We were afraid you'd make us dance together. The Von Trapp Family Dancers! The all laugh.  "The Sound of Musc" 35.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: May I have this dance young man?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Since its you Fraulein Maria. They begin to dance as the children look on. The captain enters. He walks over to Maria & Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: May I cut in.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: (surprised) Oh dear. (smiles) yes. The dance. The baroness appears. Maria looks into his eyes and suddenly stops. MARIA (cont'd) I...I seem to have forgotten the rest.

dialogues.speaker: BARONESS
dialogues.text: (clearing her throat) There you are darling. Maria and the captain quickly break apart.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Good evening Baroness. (she curtseys) If you'll excuse me. Come along children. Maria exits with the children.

dialogues.speaker: ALL CHILDREN
dialogues.text: Good night Father, Baroness.

dialogues.speaker: BARONESS
dialogues.text: I really must speak to the cook about the wienerschnitzel. ItвЂ™s entirely too delicious for my figure...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Baroness, ...IвЂ™ve.

dialogues.speaker: BARONESS
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t. DonвЂ™t say another word. You see, uh, there are other things IвЂ™ve been thinking of. While planning this party over the past few weeks...IвЂ™ve seen the way you look at Maria. I know youвЂ™ve grown fond of her. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Sound of Musc" 36. BARONESS (cont'd) (pause) Now if youвЂ™1ll excuse me, IвЂ™m going to go back inside and pack my little things and go back to Vienna where I belong. Somewhere out there is a young lady who I think...will never be a nun. The Baroness hugs the captina and exits. Frau Schmitt & Frau Franz enter with Maxine with another telegram.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN SCHMITT
dialogues.text: Captain, another telegram has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: I really think the children should be in the festival. They are so very talented (pause) is everything okay? The captain opens the telegram and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: They've offered me a commission in their Navy. I've been requested to report tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: I knew this day would come but so soon?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: I have to find Maria.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 8 INT. THE CAPTAINS MANSION
dialogues.text: The children sit around as Maria and the Captain hold hands. They are in their play clothes holding suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Children, the captain and I have decided to leave Austria. The Captain and maria are holding hands

dialogues.speaker: LIESL
dialogues.text: Why are you holding hands father?

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Did you marry Maria The Captain looks at Marie and smiles.  "The Sound of Musc" 37.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: Not yet. All of the children run to Maria and hug her.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGITTA
dialogues.text: Our new mother.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well not yet. But we have to hurry. Come along now children. We have to be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: GRETLE
dialogues.text: Because itвЂ™s night time?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: I will miss you all. I wish you could be singing in my festival tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: Perhaps another time. They shake hands. Fraulein Schmitt enters with two soldiers. They are Rolf and Herr Zeller.

dialogues.speaker: FRAULEIN SCHMITT
dialogues.text: I tried to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: That's okay Fraulein Schmitt.

dialogues.speaker: LT. HERR ZELLER
dialogues.text: Going somewhere Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: WE were just going for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: ROLF
dialogues.text: Convenient, you are supposed to report for duty for the German Navy tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LIESL
dialogues.text: Rolf! What are you doing. Rolf stares straight ahead ignoring her. Maria hugs her close as she silently cries.  "The Sound of Musc" 38.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VON TRAPP
dialogues.text: Was I. I donвЂ™t recall receiving a telegram about that.

dialogues.speaker: HERR ZELLER
dialogues.text: You've received several and IвЂ™m here to take you directly myself.

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: Well, thatвЂ™s impossible gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: ROLF
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: The family Von Trapp is singing in the Salsberg festival this evening. ItвЂ™s all arrange.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I only hope we arenвЂ™t too late. We should really get going.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER HAMMERSTEIN
dialogues.text: Once again, how convenient.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE ROGESTER
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s go captain. The general is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: HERR ZELLER
dialogues.text: STOP! You will sing, you will all sing. But that is only because I want it to be. I want the people of Salzburg to see that nothing has changed. I shall escort you myself. Carry on. They all exit. SCENE 9 EXT. SALZBURG TOWN CENTER. Lights up on Maxine introduces the next Salzberg contestant. There are various contestants that go on before the Von Trapp family. There are puppets, singers, & dancers.

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: May I present the Salzburg Puppets! вЂњLONGELY GOATHEARD SONGвЂќ BEGINS  "The Sound of Musc" 39.

dialogues.speaker: SALZBURG PUPPETS, (ALL NUNS)
dialogues.text: High on a hill was a lonely goatherd Layee odl, layee odl layee-oo Loud was the voice of the lonely goatherd Layee odl, layee odl-oo Folks in a town that was quite remote heard Layee odl, layee odl layee-oo Lusty and clear from the goatherd's throat heard Layee odl, layee odl-oo Oho layee odllee-oo Oho layee odl ay! Oho layee odllee-oo Hododlleeoay! Maxine finally announces the Von Trapp Family.

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: Thank you. May I introduce the Family Von Trapp.

dialogues.speaker: NO.
dialogues.text: "The Sound of Musc" 40.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I LEAVE AND HEAVE A SIGH AND SAY GOODBYE -вЂ”-

dialogues.speaker: MAXINE
dialogues.text: Thank you everyone. That concludes our show. Please sit while the judges give us the winner of the show. Enter a girl with an envelope. MAXINE (cont'd) In second place, the Salzburg pupets! Enter the puppets bowing continuously. They exit. MAXINE (contвЂ™d) This years Salzburg festival winners are...The Family Von Trapp. (long pause) The Von Trapp Family singers....(long pause). The Family Von Trapp. A soldier runs out

dialogues.speaker: ROLF
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™re gone! Everyone gasps. The curtain clothes. The Von Trapp family has left Salzburg forever.
